Services

We provide DNA testing to trace your ancestral family. We work with labs known throughout the scientific community to provide efficient, accurate information on each customer’s DNA.

Science You Can Trust

We know you’re putting your family history and literally who you are in our hands. We take every client’s DNA testing seriously and invest heavily into scientific knowledge and research that has been certified according to the most rigorous standards in the world.

The laboratories and scientists we work with only use testing that meets the highest FDA criteria for valid clinics. Our scientists and labs are all CLIA-certified and CAP-accredited.

23 Chromosomes, One Individual

As an individual, your body is comprised of billions of cells and you are defined by unique DNA. Within this DNA lies more knowledge than you ever could have imagined, such as:

  • 1
    Ethnicity and Origin - Ever wondered if you were Jewish, Chinese or Latino? We can help you discover the truth.
  • 2
    Health – There are genetic diseases carried only by specific people groups. In your very DNA may lie the beginning of diseases you were never aware of.
  • 3
    Traits – Hair, nose, skin type and more are all locked into your DNA. The more you know, the more power you have.

Certified, Private Labs

Our labs protect you. The lab we work with and all of its technicians meet CLIA standards (the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988). Not only will your DNA test be performed successfully and effectively, but your privacy is one of our primary concerns. You are trusting us with a piece of yourself, your very essence, we will guard that with intense scrutiny

How We Discover the Historic “You”

Rather than saliva, which has a short shelf life, our DNA tests are performed using a buccal swab kit which you will receive at home.

The sample is taken from the inside of the cheek and is quick, simple and extremely convenient to protect (it lasts up to three months).

Question?

Check out our FAQ page and let us explain our company history and our process in detail.

Call today, your DNA controls the past, which controls your future.

FAQ

How does it work?

Your DNA analysis is performed in US laboratories that are certified to meet CLIA standards—the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988.

A CLIA-certified lab must meet certain quality standards, including qualifications for individuals who perform the test and other standards that ensure the accuracy and reliability of results.

We use leading technology to genotype your DNA—a custom Illumina HumanOmniExpress-24 format chip.

Customer Stories. Genetic Journeys.

We hear from thousands of customers around the world who write in to tell us about their 23andMe experience—and the impact it has had on their life.

See stories that inspire us.

What service do you provide?

Due to applicable regulations, 23andMe only offers an Ancestry Personal Genetic Service in international markets and health reports are not available. The service is in English only. It requires submitting a saliva sample using our saliva collection kit that you send to the lab for analysis.

Our Ancestry Service helps you understand who you are, where your DNA comes from and your family story. We analyze, compile and distill your DNA information into reports on your Ancestry Composition, Haplogroups, Neanderthal Ancestry, Your DNA Family and provide a DNA Relatives tool to enable you to connect with relatives who share similar DNA.

How your DNA becomes a report.

Human DNA is about 99.5% identical from person to person. However, there are small differences that make each person unique. These differences are called variants.

Your DNA was passed down from your parents—and their parents and so on. Variants can be linked to certain health conditions, traits and ancestry groups.

Your saliva contains DNA from cells in your mouth. We send you a saliva collection kit and instructions for providing your sample.

Our CLIA-certified lab extracts DNA from cells in your saliva sample. Then the lab processes the DNA on a genotyping chip that reads hundreds of thousands of variants in your genome.

Why genetics is only part of the story.

Human DNA is about 99.5% identical from person to person. However, there are small differences that make each person unique. These differences are called variants.

Our process at work.

To ensure quality, your DNA analysis is performed in US laboratories that are certified by CLIA (Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988) and accredited by the College of American Pathologists (CAP).

More about our lab.

How does it work?

Your DNA analysis is performed in US laboratories that are certified to meet CLIA standards—the Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments of 1988.

A CLIA-certified lab must meet certain quality standards, including qualifications for individuals who perform the test and other standards that ensure the accuracy and reliability of results.

We use leading technology to genotype your DNA—a custom Illumina HumanOmniExpress-24 format chip.
